snippet: Because of diseases like canker and citrus greening, along with hurricanes, Florida’s expected grapefruit production this year is just 40 percent of what it was a decade ago.
abstract: Florida’s expected grapefruit production of 16 million boxes in 2014 is just 40 percent of what it was a decade ago; grapefruit has suffered diseases like canker and citrus greening, along with hurricanes; some growers have shut down, but long-timers who remain are plunging millions of dollars into the land in all-out bid to save crop.
lead_paragraph: Because of diseases like canker and citrus greening, along with hurricanes, Florida’s expected grapefruit production this year is just 40 percent of what it was a decade ago.

headline.main: For Florida Grapefruit, One Blow After Another
headline.print_headline: For Florida Grapefruit, One Blow After Another
